banner.title: Need help with the system?
banner.subtitle: Find answers to frequently asked questions or contact our technical support team.

questions.q1: What is the Technical Department Management System?
questions.a1: It's a platform designed to manage equipment, technicians, and service orders efficiently. It allows tracking repairs, generating reports, and managing equipment inventory.
questions.q2: How can I navigate through the system?
questions.a2: Use the sidebar menu to access different sections of the system. The main dashboard shows you a summary of recent activity and important statistics.
questions.q3: Can I customize the system interface?
questions.a3: Yes, you can customize various aspects of the interface from your profile, including dark mode, font size, and language.

questions.q1: How do I add new equipment to the system?
questions.a1: Go to the 'Equipment' section and click on the 'New Equipment' button. Fill out the form with the required data and save the changes.
questions.q2: Can I delete equipment that already has associated orders?
questions.a2: No, for data integrity, you cannot delete equipment that has associated service orders. This ensures that the repair history is maintained.
questions.q3: What information should I include in the equipment description?
questions.a3: It's recommended to include technical specifications, serial number, physical condition, and any other relevant information that helps identify the equipment.

questions.q1: How do I assign a technician to a service order?
questions.a1: When creating or editing a service order, select the technician from the dropdown menu. Only active technicians in the system will be shown.
questions.q2: Can I view the history of orders attended by a technician?
questions.a2: Yes, in the 'Reports' section you can generate a report filtered by technician that shows all the orders they have attended.
questions.q3: How do I mark a technician as inactive?
questions.a3: In the technician's profile, change their status to 'Inactive'. This will prevent them from being assigned new orders but will maintain their history in the system.

questions.q1: What are the possible states of an order?
questions.a1: An order can be in the following states: Pending (newly created), In Process (assigned to a technician), Repaired (technical work completed), Delivered (returned to the customer), or Not Repairable.
questions.q2: How do I register the delivery of a repaired equipment?
questions.a2: Open the corresponding order and change its status to 'Delivered'. The system will automatically record the date and time of delivery.
questions.q3: Can I attach files to a service order?
questions.a3: Yes, you can attach photos, PDF documents, or other relevant files as evidence of the equipment's condition or technical documentation.

questions.q1: What types of reports can I generate?
questions.a1: You can generate reports of orders by technician, by equipment type, by department, and average repair time. All reports can be filtered by date range.
questions.q2: Can I export the generated reports?
questions.a2: Yes, you can print the reports or save them as PDF using your browser's print functionality.
questions.q3: How can I view the general statistics of the department?
questions.a3: The main dashboard shows a summary of the most important statistics. For more detailed analysis, use the Reports section.

questions.q1: How do I change my password?
questions.a1: Go to your profile, select the 'Security' tab, and use the password change form. You will need to enter your current password and the new password twice.
questions.q2: How do I change the system language?
questions.a2: In your profile, go to the 'Configuration' tab and select the desired language in the 'Language' section. The changes will be applied immediately.
questions.q3: What do I do if I forget my password?
questions.a3: On the login screen, click on 'Forgot Password' and follow the instructions to reset it through your registered email.
